newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING says Barings profit target Dfl 200 mln.
newsitem.headline: ING says Barings profit target Dfl 200 mln.

text.p: Internationale Nederlanden Groep NV (ING) said its Barings merchant banking unit was currently earning an annual net profit of about 100 million guilders and aiming for annual profits of 200 million.
Executive Board Chairman Aad Jacobs said ING expected Barings, like all its other operations, to earn a net return of at least 11 percent on capital invested.
"That means that this group would have to earn 200 million guilders a year, roughly speaking, before we are satisfied," he told a news conference on ING's interim results.
ING bought Barings for 1.7 billion guilders in March 1995.
He also said Barings was currently earning enough to cover the opportunity costs of the acquisition.
"They have fulfilled all of the expectations we have set," Jacobs said.
An ING spokesman told Reuters that Barings earned in the first half of 1996 an after-tax, or net, return of five percent on its two billion guilders of capital.
Jacobs also said Barings as it is now was becoming more difficult to compare with the bank ING bought last year as it had been integrated into the ING Barings business unit.
